content.description: The function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is continuous and increasing on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 6, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></math> and <math alttext="the integral from 0 to 6, of, f of x, d x, equals 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></math>. Consider Riemann sums with three subintervals of equal length for <math alttext="the integral from 0 to 6, of, f of x, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>. Which of the following statements must be true?
content.question: <math alttext="2 times f of 0, plus 2 times f of 2, plus 2 times f of 4, is less than 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.15em"></mspace><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.15em"></mspace><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.15em"></mspace><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo><</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></math><math alttext="2 times f of 1, plus 2 times f of 3, plus 2 times f of 5, is greater than 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.15em"></mspace><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.15em"></mspace><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.15em"></mspace><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></math><math alttext="2 times f of 2, plus 2 times f of 4, plus 2 times f of 6, is greater than 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.15em"></mspace><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.15em"></mspace><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.15em"></mspace><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Explain how an approximated value relates to the actual value.
